dismissalText.commentary: Towhid Hridoy c †Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fazalhaq Farooqi 51 (69b 3x4 0x6 111m) SR: 73.91

dismissalComment.html: Edged and gone! Goes short outside off and Hridoy takes a few steps forward and across before trying to cut. The width wasn't quite there on offer and he can only manage an edge that Gurbaz is happy to gobble up! A valiant effort from Hridoy comes to an end

dismissalText.long: c Rahmat Shah b Mujeeb Ur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Rahmat Shah b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 26 (35b 2x4 1x6 62m) SR: 74.28

dismissalComment.html: Litton pulls it straight to deep-backward square, he cannot believe it and is at the crease till a minute or so later. Mujeeb was on flight right after it was taken. It was a half-tracker down leg. Litton made room, exposed all three stumps, and cleared his front leg and lumped it but could not find the timing. It went flat and into the palms of Rahmat, who took it in front of his chest with a little lunge.

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: Edged and taken! Tamim pays the price for opening the bat face fully. He tried to guide the back-of-length ball around fifth stump to deep third, ended up tickling it to the Gurbaz for a regulation catch. Farooqi leaps in the air as Tamim walks back disappointed. It looked like Tamim started the shot with an angled bat and just opened it further to get it fine, that got the tickle close to the sticker. Gift of a wicket though, given Afghanistan's extras were had put them off track.

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Big lbw appeal is upheld. Mehidy reviews. Shortish ball from wide of the crease angles in, doesn't bounce as much as Mehidy expects. He crouches and tries to pull. Gets beaten on the pull and is hit high on the pad and between the thighs. He's in front of the stumps. Hawk-Eye shows three reds, review lost. Reward for Farooqi who's kept the length consistently on the shorter side. A bit of variable bounce helps him get his second.

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Saleem b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Najmul Hossain Shanto c Mohammad Saleem b Mohammad Nabi 12 (16b 2x4 0x6 31m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Nabi strikes first ball and it's a soft serve with the waffle. It was full and down leg, Shanto went on one knee and swept it. There was slight indecision and it popped up off the top edge. Saleem, at short fine, took a dolly.

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Azmatullah Omarzai
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Mohammad Nabi b Azmatullah Omarzai 15 (38b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 39.47

dismissalComment.html: Oh what a catch at cover! Shakib went for the drive but hits it uppish and Nabi dives to his right and grabs it very low. Omarzai had an expensive first over, but now he has come back to get rid of Bangladesh's danger man in the middle order! Omarzai pitched it up close to off and Shakib's cover drive looked half-hearted

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 7 (19b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 36.84

dismissalComment.html: Big shout and the umpire raises his finger immediately! Taskin reviews after pondering over it. Mujeeb, from around the wicket, floated it up on a length outside off. Taskin plays for the turn away but the ball goes in with the angle to rap him on the knee roll of the back pad. HawkEye returns three reds, Bangladesh are out of reviews and eight wickets down. The decision to give Mujeeb a ninth over pays dividends

dismissalText.long: c Najmul Hossain Shanto b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmanullah Gurbaz c Najmul Hossain Shanto b Shakib Al Hasan 22 (45b 1x4 0x6 66m) SR: 48.88

dismissalComment.html: Goes for the big shot and perishes! Gurbaz skips out to a full delivery but hits it straight to midwicket. Could not get it high enough and Shanto takes a good catch above his head. Gurbaz is livid as he walks off. It's that man Shakib again with the breakthrough when Bangladesh need it!

commentTextItems.html: Back of a length and he pulls it away to deep midwicket. And it looks like it is raining again. Covers are coming on

commentPostTextItems.html: 11.02pm Right then, that will be that from Chattogram today. We had rain breaks, but some good cricket in between. Hopefully less of the former and more of the latter when we return on Saturday for the second ODI. Until then, thanks and goodnight! This is Abhimanyu, signing off on behalf of Ekanth and Venkat and everyone else at ESPNcricinfo.

Now, Shahidi: "I think our bowlers did very well. Stuck to plans and on the field we were very good. Nabi's catch changed the game for us. [On the chase] The way Gurbaz and Ibrahim started, that's what we were expecting from them. Told them to not rush, score is not that bad. Have to play accordingly. Just play out the first ten overs and leave the risk to other players. [On Farooqi] He's okay, it was just cramps. He will recover [ahead of the next game]."
Player of the match, Fazalhaq Farooqi, with Shahidi translating: "I wanted to bowl in right areas. My aim was that and I achieved that."

Tamim Iqbal (and this is not verbatim): I thought the weather and the other things, I don't think we need to blame the other things. I think we had a very good start, but then we lost our way, we lost back-to-back wickets twice. And there were no unbelievable balls or unplayable balls. And when you put on 169, it's not enough. This wicket was a little tricky. If we put up 250-260, it would have been good. [On Hridoy] Every time he goes out to bat, he impresses everyone.

10.40pm Thanks Ekanth. Well, at least we have a result! Afghanistan seemed to have a stranglehold on the game right from the time Litton Das and Najmul Hossain Shanto fell in quick succession. The two rain breaks in the first innings only helped Bangladesh avoid getting bowled out, but Towhid Hridoy's fighting fifty was not enough to get them close to a big enough total in what was going to be a shortened game anyway. Bangladesh bowlers kept things tight, but Ibrahim Zadran and Rahmanullah Gurbaz hung around, with the former especially keeping things ticking. Gurbaz was out trying to go for a big shot but Zadran kept going. By the time Rahmat Shah got out, Afghanistan were already ahead of the DLS par score. HD Ackermann says on air that Fazalhaq Farooqi's injury, for which he went off after bowling four deliveries of his last over, is not serious and he should be fit for the next game.

10:35pm: Unfortunately, the first ODI has come to a wet end is the call from on-air comms. Afghanistan win by 17 runs on DLS is the verdict. Post-match presentation will be on in a bit. So will Abhimanyu to report it here.

10:20pm: Mohammad Isam pings that If there's no further rain, then the match will resume at 10:35pm local time. The revised target will be 111 runs in 29 overs, which will mean 28 runs needed in the remaining 7.2 overs . A few seconds later, the text he sent reads 'Covers back on'. I don't know how to feel about any of this. Well, the square does get covered. But there are a few people surrounding it. Make of that what you will. At 10:27pm, the covers are removed from the square again. At 10:29pm, they are back on. "More drizzle," informs Isam.
Aziz El Sabri: "As an Afghan fan, it's always great to win with hitting boundary then never coming down to playing field. So we would love to see a winning run coming of Ibrahim Zadran's bat."
10:10pm: The green covers above and below the blue ones are coming off. So the rain doesn't seem to be an issue anymore.
Ollie: "Is it even worth coming back on? What will Afghanistan need, another 5 runs with 8 wickets in hand or something daft? "
9:55pm: Drizzle still on but a few people have now congregated around the covers. An umbrella goes up in the chat. No clear indications of what'll happen, yet.

9:45pm: Thanks, Abhimanyu. Round 3 of rain interruptions could land the knockout punch. The green squares are being brought on to supplement the blue ones on the pitch and squares. Overs will be lost if play restarts, given two overs or so have been lost already.

Benji: "Got to congratulate the Afghanistan openers on what a superb job they did in the face of some superb early bowling, could easily have lost 3 or 4 wickets then Bangladesh would be ahead on DLS but they stood firm "

9.35pm So, a third rain interruption as the groundstaff bring the covers on! This means, we will lose more overs. Also, if there is no more play possible, Afghanistan will win. The par score for them, for the loss of two wickets, is 66, so Afghanistan are well ahead. Stay tuned for more updates as the rain comes down in Chattogram. Ekanth will be here to share any new news with you!

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c †Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fazalhaq Farooqi 13 (21b 2x4 0x6 36m) SR: 61.9

dismissalComment.html: Edged and taken! Tamim pays the price for opening the bat face fully. He tried to guide the back-of-length ball around fifth stump to deep third, ended up tickling it to the Gurbaz for a regulation catch. Farooqi leaps in the air as Tamim walks back disappointed. It looked like Tamim started the shot with an angled bat and just opened it further to get it fine, that got the tickle close to the sticker. Gift of a wicket though, given Afghanistan's extras were had put them off track.

dismissalText.long: c Rahmat Shah b Mujeeb Ur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Rahmat Shah b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 26 (35b 2x4 1x6 62m) SR: 74.28

dismissalComment.html: Litton pulls it straight to deep-backward square, he cannot believe it and is at the crease till a minute or so later. Mujeeb was on flight right after it was taken. It was a half-tracker down leg. Litton made room, exposed all three stumps, and cleared his front leg and lumped it but could not find the timing. It went flat and into the palms of Rahmat, who took it in front of his chest with a little lunge.

dismissalComment.html: Big appeal as Rashid's legbreak on a length beats the flick. Umpire says no but Afghanistan review That pitched on leg and turned. No bat, ultraedge confirms. dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz lbw b Fazalhaq Farooqi 5 (23b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 21.73

dismissalComment.html: Big lbw appeal is upheld. Mehidy reviews. Shortish ball from wide of the crease angles in, doesn't bounce as much as Mehidy expects. He crouches and tries to pull. Gets beaten on the pull and is hit high on the pad and between the thighs. He's in front of the stumps. Hawk-Eye shows three reds, review lost. Reward for Farooqi who's kept the length consistently on the shorter side. A bit of variable bounce helps him get his second.

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 7 (19b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 36.84

dismissalComment.html: Big shout and the umpire raises his finger immediately! Taskin reviews after pondering over it. Mujeeb, from around the wicket, floated it up on a length outside off. Taskin plays for the turn away but the ball goes in with the angle to rap him on the knee roll of the back pad. HawkEye returns three reds, Bangladesh are out of reviews and eight wickets down. The decision to give Mujeeb a ninth over pays dividends

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c †Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fazalhaq Farooqi 13 (21b 2x4 0x6 36m) SR: 61.9

dismissalComment.html: Edged and taken! Tamim pays the price for opening the bat face fully. He tried to guide the back-of-length ball around fifth stump to deep third, ended up tickling it to the Gurbaz for a regulation catch. Farooqi leaps in the air as Tamim walks back disappointed. It looked like Tamim started the shot with an angled bat and just opened it further to get it fine, that got the tickle close to the sticker. Gift of a wicket though, given Afghanistan's extras were had put them off track.

dismissalText.long: c Rahmat Shah b Mujeeb Ur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Rahmat Shah b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 26 (35b 2x4 1x6 62m) SR: 74.28

dismissalComment.html: Litton pulls it straight to deep-backward square, he cannot believe it and is at the crease till a minute or so later. Mujeeb was on flight right after it was taken. It was a half-tracker down leg. Litton made room, exposed all three stumps, and cleared his front leg and lumped it but could not find the timing. It went flat and into the palms of Rahmat, who took it in front of his chest with a little lunge.

dismissalComment.html: Nabi strikes first ball and it's a soft serve with the waffle. It was full and down leg, Shanto went on one knee and swept it. There was slight indecision and it popped up off the top edge. Saleem, at short fine, took a dolly.

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Azmatullah Omarzai
dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Mohammad Nabi b Azmatullah Omarzai 15 (38b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 39.47

dismissalComment.html: Oh what a catch at cover! Shakib went for the drive but hits it uppish and Nabi dives to his right and grabs it very low. Omarzai had an expensive first over, but now he has come back to get rid of Bangladesh's danger man in the middle order! Omarzai pitched it up close to off and Shakib's cover drive looked half-hearted

dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz lbw b Fazalhaq Farooqi 5 (23b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 21.73

dismissalComment.html: Big lbw appeal is upheld. Mehidy reviews. Shortish ball from wide of the crease angles in, doesn't bounce as much as Mehidy expects. He crouches and tries to pull. Gets beaten on the pull and is hit high on the pad and between the thighs. He's in front of the stumps. Hawk-Eye shows three reds, review lost. Reward for Farooqi who's kept the length consistently on the shorter side. A bit of variable bounce helps him get his second.

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 7 (19b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 36.84

dismissalComment.html: Big shout and the umpire raises his finger immediately! Taskin reviews after pondering over it. Mujeeb, from around the wicket, floated it up on a length outside off. Taskin plays for the turn away but the ball goes in with the angle to rap him on the knee roll of the back pad. HawkEye returns three reds, Bangladesh are out of reviews and eight wickets down. The decision to give Mujeeb a ninth over pays dividends
